section.heading: DFS reporting requirement.
section.text: In the annual report filed pursuant to § 5-1501.04(a)(5), the Director of the DFS shall provide, for the prior calendar year:

para.text: The number of PERKs received from the MPD;
The number of PERKs processed by the DFS or an accredited laboratory to which the DFS delegated the processing;
The average time it took for PERKs to be processed by the DFS or an accredited laboratory to which the DFS delegated the processing;
The longest period of time it took for PERKs to be processed by the DFS or an accredited laboratory to which the DFS delegated the processing;
The number of PERKS involved in consumption litigation;
The number of times in which an accredited laboratory to which the DFS delegated the processing failed to comply with the time periods described in § 4-561.02(b);
If permission to consume was requested, the number of cases in which processing was completed 90 days after the PERK was received by the DFS due to consumption litigation; and
The number of days in which each PERK was delayed awaiting a consumption litigation determination.

annotations.annotation: Section 9(a) of D.C. Law 23-57 provided that the amendments made to this section shall apply as of October 1, 2020. Therefore those amendments shall be implemented for this section on October 1, 2020.
